content:
Hi! I'm having a problem with rustdoc.
I tried to put withing the [build] section of my Cargo.toml the following line: 

rustdocflags = "--html-in-header /absolute/path/to/doc/katex-header.html"

However, it doesn't show up when I call cargo doc --verbose --open.
I followed this guide https://doc.rust-lang.org/cargo/reference/config.html#buildrustdocflags
Am I missing something?
@Michele Orrù Config settings go in config files like .cargo/config.toml, not Cargo.toml.
oh.. I don't get it: why rustflagscan be there and rustdocflags can't? and can I do something like [patch.cargo.build] with the same rustdocflags?
@Eric Huss already, thank you so much for your help!

rustflags can't be in Cargo.toml either, so I'm not sure I understand the question.

[patch] is only for replacing dependencies.
oh I see, and whoa I just realized my rustflags were also in the wrong place.. sorry for the nose!
One last question then: would it be fair for a project to have its own .cargo/config.toml or that's supposed to be left up to the end developer?
Both. It's intended to be for the end developer, but many projects have one checked in.
